intro: Peucedanum argense, commonly known as the Armenian cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in compound umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Peucedanum argense is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
